case_vignette: A 60-year-old woman is brought to the emergency department because of altered mental status for 2 hours. She and her husband were at the grocery store when she suddenly could not remember why she was there or how she got there. She has not had any head trauma. She has a history of depression and migraines. She does not smoke and drinks a glass of wine each night with dinner. She takes fluoxetine daily. She appears distressed and anxious. Her vital signs are within normal limits. She is fully alert and oriented to self and place but not to time. Every few minutes she asks how she got to the emergency department. She is able to follow commands and sustain attention. She recalls 3/3 objects immediately and recalls 0/3 objects at 5 minutes. The remainder of the neurological exam shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I suddenly couldn't remember why I was at the grocery store or how I got there, and now I keep asking how I got to the emergency department.
Have you had any recent head injuries or traumas?
No, I have not had any head trauma.
Do you have a history of neurological conditions like epilepsy or migraines?
Yes, I have a history of migraines.
Have you experienced any headache, nausea, or light sensitivity with this episode?
No, I haven't mentioned experiencing any headache, nausea, or light sensitivity with this episode.
Are you currently taking any medication or have you recently taken any new medication?
I take fluoxetine daily.
How old are you, and what is your sex?
I am a 60-year-old woman.
Have you experienced any recent stress or sleep disturbances?
I haven't mentioned any recent stress or sleep disturbances.
Are there any other symptoms present, such as difficulty speaking, weakness, numbness, or changes in vision?
No, the rest of my neurological exam shows no abnormalities.
Do you have any personal or family history of memory disorders or dementia?
I haven't mentioned any personal or family history of memory disorders or dementia.
Final Diagnosis: Transient Global Amnesia.
